property.description: This villa was built in an exclusive and private position with a splendid panoramic view of the suggestive Gulf of Alassio. Immersed in a large private park of 3.000 m2, spread over three large terraces, perfectly landscaped with lawn and enclosed by a wall and Corten steel, the villa was designed by a Turin architect with the aim of combining modernity and tradition, as a parallelepiped with rounded corners "resting" on the stone of the original rustico, with careful selection of the contrasting materials: sandstone plaster, split stone, iron, glass. The upper part, facing south, rests on the stone base facing south-east, thus achieving a phase shift that allows the shaded area in front of the house to be used as a veranda. The property, cared for down to the smallest detail, with an internal surface of about 500 m2, consists of an exclusive manor villa, where elegance and refinement combine with the most modern technology, and an autonomous and separate annex that directly overlooks the swimming pool. On the lower floor, which is very bright thanks to the large windows overlooking the garden, there is a leisure area, some bedrooms and two bathrooms. The large swimming pool 15x6m and a comfortable covered garage, as well as a large outdoor area that can accommodate up to 12 cars, complete the property.The possibility of building a third plot for residential purposes with a garage is provided.Alassio is located in the "Baia del Sole". It is a popular tourist seaside resort thanks to a fine sandy beach of over 3 km. Here there are pure waters (beautiful backdrops and a variety of marine life) and a climate that always ensures a good temperature. The marina has 450 berths. The name of Alassio is linked to the "Muretto", invented by Mario Berrino, patron of the Caffè Roma, and the writer Ernest Hemingway. We go back in the 50s: Berrino wanted to embellish the walls of the public gardens. He thought of ceramic tiles signed by famous people: the first were Hemingway, the Quartetto Cetra and Cosimo Di Ceglie (about 740 pieces). Here is the contest of the "Miss Muretto". The old town runs alongside the beach with the fishermen's houses and Via XX Settembre, known to tourists as "budello" but which remains a typical Ligurian "caruggiu" between shops and prestigious stores. And then the countless hotels of Alassio and the historic buildings: Palazzo Ferrero de Gubernatis ('700), Palazzo Scofferi (another dependence) in Via Veneto and, in Via Milite Ignoto, the Palazzi Vallega, Brea (Via Dante) and Montanaro (Piazza Della Valle). Near the seat is the Ciccione promenade lined with pine trees: do not miss the view from the jetty. Alassio has typical products to taste: from fish salami (bottarga, mosciame, ventresca) to desserts (Kiss, Baci di Alassio ) .CASARIVERA is a full-service real estate agency based in Albenga, operating throughout the Italian Riviera and beyond. property.title: Ref. 743 In the South“ starts here – your villa with history, ALASSIO
property.description: Villa San Giovanni is a historic villa with timeless charm, located in one of Alassio's most convenient and exclusive neighborhoods. This prestigious late 19th-century residence harmoniously combines the elegance of yesteryear with the comforts of today.The atmosphere is unique and refined: the ceiling height, the arched windows, the parquet and terrazzo floors give the villa a very special, classic character.The detached property extends over three levels, which are connected by an impressive marble staircase and a comfortable elevator.The ground floor houses the living area, consisting of a spacious double living room and a light-filled dining room—both with direct access to the terrace and garden. There's also a fully equipped kitchen, a laundry room with a utility room, and a bedroom with a bathroom.On the mezzanine floor, the hallway leads to a second bedroom with en-suite bathroom.The second and top floor houses three spacious bedrooms, all with en-suite bathrooms and access to a magnificent panoramic terrace. There's also a charming study area with a retro-style glass-enclosed veranda and access to the garden.The villa is spacious and comfortably designed—ideal for entertaining guests, friends, and family. All five bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms, ensuring maximum comfort and privacy.The well-kept garden surrounds the villa on all four sides and offers an oasis of peace – just a few steps from the center of Alassio.The villa is located in a quiet residential area, just a few minutes' walk from Alassio's most beautiful beaches and all the amenities of the town center.A special anecdote that makes this dream villa even more unique:Edward Elgar, one of the most important English composers, spent the winter of 1903–1904 with his family in this villa in Alassio.Here he found the inspiration for one of his most famous works: the concert overture “In the South (Alassio)”.The seascape, ancient ruins and Mediterranean atmosphere of Alassio inspired Elgar to create a composition that musically reflects the light, warmth and beauty of the region – a colorful work that translates the soul of the Riviera Ligure into music.We would be happy to show you this exclusive property in person.Please note that viewings can only be arranged for serious interested parties with the appropriate financial basis.

Here there are pure waters (beautiful backdrops and a variety of marine life) and a climate that always ensures a good temperature. The marina has 450 berths. The name of Alassio is linked to the "Muretto", invented by Mario Berrino, patron of the Caffè Roma, and the writer Ernest Hemingway. We go back in the 50s: Berrino wanted to embellish the walls of the public gardens. He thought of ceramic tiles signed by famous people: the first were Hemingway, the Quartetto Cetra and Cosimo Di Ceglie (about 740 pieces). Here is the contest of the "Miss Muretto". The old town runs alongside the beach with the fishermen's houses and Via XX Settembre, known to tourists as "budello" but which remains a typical Ligurian "caruggiu" between shops and prestigious stores. And then the countless hotels of Alassio and the historic buildings: Palazzo Ferrero de Gubernatis ('700), Palazzo Scofferi (another dependence) in Via Veneto and, in Via Milite Ignoto, the Palazzi Vallega, Brea (Via Dante) and Montanaro (Piazza Della Valle). property.description: This villa was built in an exclusive and private position with a splendid panoramic view of the suggestive Gulf of Alassio. Immersed in a large private park of 3.000 m2, spread over three large terraces, perfectly landscaped with lawn and enclosed by a wall and Corten steel, the villa was designed by a Turin architect with the aim of combining modernity and tradition, as a parallelepiped with rounded corners "resting" on the stone of the original rustico, with careful selection of the contrasting materials: sandstone plaster, split stone, iron, glass. The upper part, facing south, rests on the stone base facing south-east, thus achieving a phase shift that allows the shaded area in front of the house to be used as a veranda. The property, cared for down to the smallest detail, with an internal surface of about 500 m2, consists of an exclusive manor villa, where elegance and refinement combine with the most modern technology, and an autonomous and separate annex that directly overlooks the swimming pool. On the ground floor there is a large and functional kitchen and a large living room with study.On the upper floor is the sleeping area, consisting of 3 bedrooms with bathrooms. On the lower floor, which is very bright thanks to the large windows overlooking the garden, there is a leisure area, some bedrooms and two bathrooms. The large swimming pool 15x6m and a comfortable covered garage, as well as a large outdoor area that can accommodate up to 12 cars, complete the property.The possibility of building a third plot for residential purposes with a garage is provided.Alassio is located in the "Baia del Sole". It is a popular tourist seaside resort thanks to a fine sandy beach of over 3 km. Here there are pure waters (beautiful backdrops and a variety of marine life) and a climate that always ensures a good temperature. The marina has 450 berths. The name of Alassio is linked to the "Muretto", invented by Mario Berrino, patron of the Caffè Roma, and the writer Ernest Hemingway. We go back in the 50s: Berrino wanted to embellish the walls of the public gardens. He thought of ceramic tiles signed by famous people: the first were Hemingway, the Quartetto Cetra and Cosimo Di Ceglie (about 740 pieces). Here is the contest of the "Miss Muretto". The old town runs alongside the beach with the fishermen's houses and Via XX Settembre, known to tourists as "budello" but which remains a typical Ligurian "caruggiu" between shops and prestigious stores. And then the countless hotels of Alassio and the historic buildings: Palazzo Ferrero de Gubernatis ('700), Palazzo Scofferi (another dependence) in Via Veneto and, in Via Milite Ignoto, the Palazzi Vallega, Brea (Via Dante) and Montanaro (Piazza Della Valle). Near the seat is the Ciccione promenade lined with pine trees: do not miss the view from the jetty. Alassio has typical products to taste: from fish salami (bottarga, mosciame, ventresca) to desserts (Kiss, Baci di Alassio ) .CASARIVERA is a full-service real estate agency based in Albenga, operating throughout the Italian Riviera and beyond.
